experience: You and Kara M. both know Andrea Blasdale

All week, we will celebrate #FlexWork by sharing our employees’ work-life integration stories. Up first, Superintendent Lauren Slaven, who uses Shawmut Flex to allow for more time with her family. Learn more about Shawmut Flex here: http://ow.ly/hau3305gcr1
I stretch and drink a glass of lemon water.
I read for half an hour, then get in a 20-minute workout.
I take a cold shower, drink a protein shake and brush my teeth.
On my way to work, I listen to a podcast.
In the office, I dig deep into my creative flow.
I get tons of work done and reach my goals.
On the way back home, I call my dad and do groceries.
I make myself a healthy meal, then work out.
One hour of writing and one hour of reading.
I turn the lights off and fall asleep with a big smile on my face.
I couldn't have done more. I gave my all.
I feel amazing, on top of the world.
I have them sometimes, about once a week.
On other days, I wake up at 7:30.
I don't work out, my shower is hot, my podcast is music, social media fucks with my flow and I don't get my work done.
I don't read, I don't write. I order take-out and watch Netflix.
But I still sleep like a baby.
It's okay to not always have perfect days. It's okay to not always be on top of Motivation Mountain.
We tend to think of motivation as a tireless source of driving intrinsic energy and we get confused when we lose it, when we feel unmotivated.
But motivation is not a sprint, it's a marathon.
It's not giving up on trying to have perfect days.

recommendations: Jamel Torrence
Brand Marketing Intern at The Shark Group
October 17, 2016, Kara M. and Jamel were students together

Jamel has always had a passion for art, fashion and social media. His attention to detail and eye for art enhances his ability to capture any competitive edge within this industry. The piece he completed on Basketball and the community opened my eyes to see how much his videographer experience has developed. The piece was influential and allowed inner city kids to see that with education and hard work, you can work hard to achieve your goals.

Dana Leuzzi
Digital Marketer at Jenzabar
October 17, 2016, Dana worked with Kara M. in the same group

Dana and I worked in the Office of Human resources for 1 ½ years. In this time, Dana demonstrated excellent communication skills and always acted as a resource for me if I need assistance in any way. Dana and I worked closely to create a successful employee handbook for future student workers. This collaboration not only helped us work better together, but showed Dana’s amazing marketing/web design skills. Dana is always willing to help others and her energy makes any mundane task a lot more fun.

summary: Hello, my name is Kara Goings and I am a recent graduate from Bentley University with a major in management, concentration in leadership and minor in law. Throughout my four years, I have worked in a Human Resource role where I exhibited leadership and communication skills by creating an employee handbook, working with and managing the calendars of 15 other staff members including the President of Bentley University.I have demonstrated teamwork and management skills by being a leader in various community service positions. I was able to multitask my three different jobs on campus while simultaneously participating in community service and extracurricular activities (basketball captain, CAB member, ALANA member, etc...) I am extremely interested in working as a Recruiter, but would love to continue to be an advocate of equality in under privileged communities. With a bachelor of science degree, I aspire to work in the Human Resources department within the sports industry as a recruiter. I would love to help new people assimilate into new job roles. I will always be active in the community in order to enhance my knowledge in all aspects.
